adjectives.description: blinky (comparative more blinky, superlative most blinky)

entries.meaning: Of eyes or people/animals: blinking repeatedly, prone to blink.
examples: He was a literature professor, neurotic and blinky behind his glasses  […]

entries.meaning: (of lights, shining objects) flickery, prone to flicker
examples: […]  the rosary beads that hung from her belt like a zoot-suiter's key chain were blinky bright  […]

entries.meaning: (US, regional) Of milk: turned somewhat sour.
examples: I mean really, who needs a date stamped on the jug to tell you when milk has gone bad? It’s got a built-in warning system. First, you get that little whang in the taste. It’s gone blinky. Time to think about getting more.

entries.meaning: (photography) in digital photography, a flashing pixel.
examples: Blinkies visually indicate the areas of a photograph where the exposure is beyond the range of the film.
